title: Job Openings at Nestoil Plc
content:
Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Local Area Network - Wide Area Network (LAN-WAN) Analyst

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are on an evolutionary journey where we’re changing our story.
	We are looking to hire an experienced LAN-WAN Analyst to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, your primary objective will be to support ICT operations across Routing & Switching Data Centers, and to assist in the execution of ICT projects.


Responsibilities
As a LAN-WAN Analyst, you will be responsible for:


	Developing and supporting comprehensive network LAN, WAN, wireless and security solutions that meet requirements and integrate into the overall Obijackson Group network and security architecture.
	Evaluating current network and security systems to propose and implement network system enhancements on Network Switches, Routers, Internet Firewall Services, VPN and other Network Management devices – Defines, designs and implements network and security solutions.
	Creating and maintaining standard builds/templates and apply advanced network and security engineering and architecture knowledge on complex and diverse problems
	Participating in IT network infrastructure project design, reviews and ensuring network architecture goals and requirements are met and aligned with business objectives.
	Working with internal customers and service providers to design, implement and support networks
	Assessing vendor development/test strategies for various network domain projects.
	Performing network troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose common network problems.
	Deploying both bare metal systems and virtual cloud services.
	Supporting and collaborating on the development, implementation and administration of processes and procedures to ensure reliability
	Developing network and security documentation, including diagrams and work instructions, test plans, implementation plans, and project timelines for various projects.
	Writing functional requirements/specifications documents.
	Demonstrated confidence with the ability to present and have conversations
	Establishing best practices through collaboration with IT Security and IT Infrastructure Operations
	Collaborating with IT Security and Service Delivery toward compliance and auditing
	The ability to maintain and foster sensitivity and respect for a culturally diverse work environment.
	Ability to travel


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Network Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent industry experience 
	1 to 3 years of progressive experience in computer network design and support
	Cisco CCNA Required CCNP Good to have certifications.  Information technology certifications such as MCP, ITIL
	Knowledge and experience working with network protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, routing, firewalls, DNS, DHCP, SSH, VPNs), IP routing protocols including RIP, BGP, OSPF, IP Multicast, MPLS. Network Switching Required
	Understands service providers, TCP/IP data networks.
	Knowledge of IPv4 is must.
	Proven ability to accomplish assigned tasks with little supervision
	Ability to manage and prioritize complex, changing workloads in a challenging technical environment


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Business Development & Sales Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Summary


	We are looking to hire an experienced Business Development & Sales Manager to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities for the Obijackson Group of Companies as well as managing the relationship with current clients


Responibilities
As a Business Development & Sales Manager, you will be responsible for:


	Engaging assigned clients (NOC, IOC’s and independents) to ensure continuous visibility and participation of assigned SBU in all applicable market segments
	Overseeing the prospecting and developing new business including cold calling, scheduling client introductions, meetings and engagements, preparing and delivering presentations, documentation, proposals and bids to win new business.
	Supervising the development of sales proposals, estimates, specifications and presentations.
	Participating in trade shows, exhibitions, technology, product and service exhibitions & demonstrations, promoting company image and offerings.
	Ensuring that the SBU meets all contract terms and conditions and that all benefits derivable from each contract are fully enjoyed.
	Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with clients and key government and regulatory agencies and representatives.
	Monitoring and reporting on competitor performance and market trends and threats.
	Ensuing strict adherence to QHSE policies and procedures and complying with safe work methods as required. 
	Performing any other duty that may be assigned by Line Manager.


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Business or related field 
	Minimum of 5 years of significant experience in Business Development of Engineered solutions in the Marine/Maritime Industry.
	Any related Professional Qualification is required.
	Knowledge of tendering procedures in the in the Marine & Maritime Industry
	Strong project management skills
	Good leadership and team building skills
	Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks
	Good numeric, Analytical and Presentation skills 
	Good written and Oral communication skills
	Extensive experience of working closely with Legal, Proposals and Business development functions from a pre-contract perspective
	Ability to establish strong interpersonal relationships and successful network
	Ability to travel at short notice
	Initiative and problem-solving skills
	Highly motivated and the ability to work under tight deadlines
	Team player with excellent personnel management skills.
	Proficient in Corel Draw, Photoshop, Photo Paint, MS Office tools etc.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment (QHSE) Manager

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	We are on an evolutionary journey where we’re changing our story. We are looking to hire an experienced QHSE Manager to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, you will oversee and manage all aspects of the business’ QHSE programs. This includes developing, implementing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations.
	The role also involves conducting risk assessments, audits, and investigations, as well as promoting a culture of safety and quality throughout the business.


As a QHSE Manager, You Will Be Responsible For


	Maintaining records/registers of injuries and illnesses occurred, and treatment given by the base & field locations Medic. 
	Presenting all personnel on board with safety induction training and instructing inductees on hazards relevant to their positions. 
	Conducting regular hygiene inspections on SDI office, base and field locations. 
	Maintaining emergency medical equipment in prepared state of readiness and maintaining an accurate inventory of same. 
	Participating in and contributing to the objectives described in the MODU’s annual plan.
	Providing safety training to employees and assisting Operations & Base Manager with hazard identification, accident prevention and recognition. 
	Advising Operations & Base Manager on safety administration and safety inspections.
	Maintaining an accurate inventory of safety and lifesaving equipment in the office, base and field locations and instructing all personnel on its use.
	Ensuring that all Lifesaving Appliances such as fire extinguishers, lifeboat inventories etc. are carried out as per the maintenance program. 
	Assisting in the implementation of safety policies and procedures in accordance with local, state, federal, maritime and company regulations and monitor effectiveness. 
	Ordering and obtaining training materials and maintain a record of all training activities.
	Undertaking audits and inspections in line with the company’s audit and inspection procedures.
	Being the Custodian of national and international regulatory and compliances protocols, certifications and registrations. 
	Maintaining an up-to-date HSE and Quality Management system. 
	Coordinating and managing emergency preparedness. 
	Participating in and monitoring all safety initiatives and safety programs. 
	Participating in and monitoring all safety meetings, including weekly, pretour and pre-job/toolbox meetings. 
	Monitoring personnel and equipment for compliance with statutory requirements and the company’s policies and procedures. 
	Participating in discipline and counselling procedures relating to issues concerning safety
	Preparing and sending reports to the Line Manager on the implementation of safety programs
	Maintaining accurate personnel and training records 
	Implementing the hazard communication program 
	Overseeing the activities and duties of all Mechanics on the base and field locations.
	Performing other duties as assigned by Line Manager


What Are We Looking For


	Bachelor’s Degree in related Discipline 
	Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Safety Officer in the oil and gas industry – with at least 5 years on land, swamp, base and field locations.
	NEBOSH Certificate, Instructors’ qualifications or First-Aid/CPR
	Must maintain knowledge of hazardous waste policies and procedures 
	Excellent knowledge of QHSE principles and Laws
	Knowledge and understanding of the impact of failure of QHSE key systems and processes.
	Problem solving and Time management
	Coaching and Supervisory skills 
	Proficiency in the use of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel and Power Point) 
	Leadership skill

title: Job Vacancies at WakaFoody
content:
WakaFoody is a fast-growing food delivery platform based in Akure, focused on connecting customers with their favorite local restaurants and food vendors. With over 1,200 user sign-ups in the last six weeks and significant investment in marketing, we’re entering a critical phase of expansion.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Content Writer / Blog Manager

Job Location: Ondo (Remote)
Job type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	WakaFoody is seeking a creative and self-motivated Content Writer / Blog Manager to lead our blog and content efforts.
	You’ll be responsible for producing engaging, SEO-optimized articles around food, lifestyle, Akure culture, restaurant features, and customer experiences.
	This role is ideal for someone passionate about storytelling, digital content, and local trends.


Key Responsibilities


	Write and publish blog posts that align with WakaFoody’s voice and audience
	Cover a range of topics from food trends, top restaurants, travel tips, local events, to WakaFoody updates
	Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and maintain an editorial calendar
	Conduct interviews and write spotlights on local food vendors and communities
	Optimize all content for SEO and readability
	Manage and update existing blog content as needed
	Ensure tone, style, and formatting is consistent across posts
	Occasionally contribute to email newsletters, social captions, and landing page copy.


Requirements


	Strong writing skills with a portfolio or blog to showcase
	Previous experience managing or contributing to a blog
	Solid understanding of SEO best practices
	Ability to research and write about local lifestyle and food culture
	Familiarity with CMS tools like Sanity, WordPress, or similar is a plus
	Knowledge of Akure’s food and cultural scene is a bonus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send the following Application Documents to: hr@wakafoody.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Application Documents


	CV
	Portfolio or links to past work (if any)
	Two short paragraphs:
	
		A campaign you’ve run and what results it delivered
		One creative idea you’d use to grow WakaFoody in Akure.
	
	


 

2.) Social Media & Content Executive

Job Location: Ondo
Job type: Full-time

Role Overview


	This is more than just social media, it's about shaping the voice of WakaFoody online. You'll start trends, create engaging content, and connect with food lovers across platforms like Instagram, WhatsApp, TikTok, X (Twitter), Facebook, and more.
	From daily posts to full-on campaigns, your job is to make sure we stay on top of minds (and timelines).


Key Responsibilities
Social Media Management:


	Grow and manage WakaFoody’s presence across all major platforms.
	Post consistently with scroll-stopping visuals, videos, and captions.
	Stay updated on trends to keep the brand fun and relevant.


Content Creation & Copywriting:


	Write catchy, on-brand captions, ads, pop-ups, and promos.
	Draft content that tells compelling stories about our restaurants and offers.
	Use Canva or similar tools to create quick, attractive visuals.


Video Content Creation:


	Create fun, short-form videos (Reels, TikToks, WhatsApp Status).
	Show off meals, vendors, customer stories, and behind-the-scenes content.
	Plan and direct shoots, or guide contributors on what to send.


Campaign Strategy:


	Suggest and execute engaging campaign ideas and promotions.
	Plan weekly content themes and structure paid ads around them.
	Collaborate with our finance team to maximize budget efficiency.


Community Engagement:


	Respond to customers across DMs, comments, and groups.
	Create and manage WhatsApp groups/channels for updates and deals.
	Build an active, loyal foodie community.


Requirements


	Previous experience managing social media (brand, personal, freelance).
	Strong writing, content planning, and storytelling skills.
	Comfortable using Canva, CapCut, InShot, or similar tools.
	Creative, trend-aware, and passionate about food.
	Self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision.
	Familiarity with Akure or Nigerian food culture is a plus.


Bonus Points If You Have:


	Experience running paid ads (Meta, TikTok, X).
	Influencer or partnership experience.
	Email marketing tools (e.g., Mailchimp, Brevo).
	Food photography or video storytelling skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send the following Application Documents to: hr@wakafoody.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Application Documents


	CV
	Portfolio or links to past work (if any)
	Two short paragraphs:
	
		A campaign you’ve run and what results it delivered
		One creative idea you’d use to grow WakaFoody in Akure.
	
	


 

 

3.) Growth Marketer

Job Location: Ondo (Remote)
Job type: Full-time

About the Role


	We're on the hunt for a Growth Marketer, someone who lives and breathes growth, knows the power of data, and understands what makes people click, share, and order again.
	You’ll be responsible for driving user acquisition, engagement, and retention. From paid ads to influencer collaborations to creative experiments, you’ll take ownership of growth at WakaFoody and work closely with our social media and content teams to build a food delivery movement.


What You’ll Be Doing


	Plan, execute, and optimize Facebook & Instagram ad campaigns (acquisition, retargeting, and promotions)
	Scout and manage influencer partnerships pitch, negotiate, and track performance
	Design and test growth experiments: referral programs, flash sales, offline activations, and more
	Collaborate with our social media manager and content creator on brand campaigns
	Track key metrics like CAC, ROAS, order volume, and influencer impact
	Prepare weekly growth reports and share actionable insights with the team


Requirements
What We’re Looking For:


	1–3 years of experience in digital/growth/performance marketing
	Strong command of Meta Ads Manager (or equivalent platforms)
	Experience working with or managing influencers
	Comfortable with numbers: CAC, CTR, ROAS, conversion rates, etc.
	Creative thinker with a strong understanding of Nigerian markets — especially outside of Lagos
	Self-starter who executes quickly and independently


Bonus Points If You:


	Have worked in food, lifestyle, or e-commerce brands
	Live in or are familiar with Akure
	Can write compelling ad copy or brainstorm creative campaign ideas


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send the following Application Documents to: hr@wakafoody.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Application Documents


	CV
	Portfolio or links to past work (if any)
	Two short paragraphs:
	
		A campaign you’ve run and what results it delivered
		One creative idea you’d use to grow WakaFoody in Akure.
	
	
    

    

        Click here to Apply
